meanings.definition: A television program that promotes a product or service in the form of a commercial.
meanings.sent1: Many people enjoy watching infomercials late at night.
meanings.sent2: Infomercials often showcase new kitchen gadgets.
meanings.sent3: The infomercials made me want to buy everything they were selling!
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like an infomercial, full of exaggerated promises.
meanings.sent5: The infomercials bombarded the viewers with flashy offers.

meanings.definition: To advertise or promote a product or service through a television program.
meanings.sent1: Companies frequently infomercials their latest products.
meanings.sent2: She decided to infomercials her handmade jewelry on TV.
meanings.sent3: He infomercials his car so enthusiastically, it was hard not to laugh.
meanings.sent4: The politician infomercials his policies like a salesman.
meanings.sent5: The chef infomercials his cooking skills on a cooking show.
